name: Ivern
title: the Green Father
lore: Ivern Bramblefoot, known to many as the Green Father, is a peculiar half man, half tree who roams Runeterra's forests, cultivating life everywhere he goes. He knows the secrets of the natural world, and holds deep friendships with all things that grow, fly, and scuttle. Ivern wanders the wilderness, imparting strange wisdom to any he meets, enriching the forests, and occasionally entrusting loose-lipped butterflies with his secrets.
blurb: Ivern Bramblefoot, known to many as the Green Father, is a peculiar half man, half tree who roams Runeterra's forests, cultivating life everywhere he goes. He knows the secrets of the natural world, and holds deep friendships with all things that grow...
allytips: Try to help allies follow up a good Rootcaller hit with Triggerseed!
Use Brushmaker to set up future ambush spots!
Daisy can block skillshots and slow down enemies. Use her to peel for your teammates!
enemytips: Ivern can be deceptively slippery. Be careful chasing him too far.
Ivern's brush has a long duration. Watch out for ambushes!
Be careful when fighting Ivern alone if he has Daisy ready to help!

riot_spells.name: Rootcaller
riot_spells.description: Ivern conjures a vine, dealing damage and rooting enemy targets hit. Ivern's allies can dash to the rooted target.
riot_spells.tooltip: Ivern conjures a vine dealing {{ e5 }} <scaleAP>(+{{ f1 }})</scaleAP> magic damage and rooting the first enemy hit for {{ e1 }} second(s). Allies can click on rooted enemies to dash into attack range.

riot_spells.name: Brushmaker
riot_spells.description: In brush, Ivern's attacks are ranged and deal bonus magic damage. Ivern can activate this ability to create a patch of brush.
riot_spells.tooltip:
Passive: In brush, Ivern's attacks are ranged and deal {{ e5 }} (+{{ f2 }}) bonus magic damage.

Active: Ivern grows a patch of brush for {{ e1 }} seconds. For 3 seconds the area in and around the brush is revealed.

riot_spells.name: Triggerseed
riot_spells.description: Ivern places a shield on an ally which explodes after a short duration slowing and damaging enemies.
riot_spells.tooltip:
Ivern shields an ally, absorbing up to {{ e1 }} (+{{ f3 }}) damage. After 2 seconds, the shield bursts dealing {{ e2 }} (+{{ f4 }}) magic damage and slowing enemies by {{ e3 }}% for {{ e4 }} seconds.

Can also be cast on Daisy.

riot_spells.name: Daisy!
riot_spells.description: Ivern summons his Sentinel friend Daisy to fight with him. Daisy will send out a shockwave if she attacks the same champion three times in a row.
riot_spells.tooltip:
Ivern summons his sentinel friend Daisy for {{ f6 }} seconds. If Daisy attacks the same champion three times in a row, she will create a shockwave knocking enemies up for 1 second (3s cooldown). Daisy has:
  • Health: {{ totaldaisyhp }}
  • Armor and Magic Resist: {{ totalbonusresists }}
  • Attack Damage: {{ totaldaisyad }}

Recast to manually issue orders to Daisy.

label: Cooldown
Daisy's Base Health
Daisy's Base Armor And Magic Resist

riot_passive.name: Friend of the Forest
riot_passive.description: Ivern cannot attack or be attacked by non-epic monsters. Ivern can create magical groves on jungle camps which grow over time. When the grove is fully grown, Ivern may free the monsters to receive gold and experience. After level 5 Ivern can share jungle buffs with allies.

i1.name: Friend of the Forest
i1.blurb: Ivern cannot attack or be attacked by non-epic monsters. Ivern can create magical groves on jungle camps which grow over time. When the grove is fully grown, Ivern may free the monsters to receive gold and experience. After level 5 Ivern can share jungle buffs with allies.
i1.description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Ivern''' cannot attack or damage non-epic [[monster]]s. Instead, targeting a jungle camp initiates a {{fd|2.5}} seconds {{ct|channel|cast=interrupts|items=interrupts,true,,false|spells=true,interrupts,interrupts,interrupts,interrupts}} that, upon completion, places the monsters within a ''grove''. Placing a ''grove'' costs {{sti|health|{{as|{{pp|(23.5-x)/100*({{Data Ivern|pst2|hp_base}}+{{Data Ivern|pst2|hp_lvl}}*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1)))|displayformula = (23.5%-1% per level) of base health}} health}}}} and {{sti|mana|{{as|{{pp|(34.5-1.5*x)/100*({{Data Ivern|pst2|mp_base}}+{{Data Ivern|pst2|mp_lvl}}*(x-1)*(0.7025+0.0175*(x-1)))|displayformula = (34.5%-1.5% per level) of base mana}} mana}}}}, and cannot be cast if '''Ivern''' lacks the resources. The channel cannot be cancelled in the first {{fd|0.15}} seconds and in the last {{fd|0.5}} seconds.
i1.description2: The ''grove'' matures over {{pp|15|40|38|36|34|32|30|27|24|21|18|15|11|7|3|1|displayformula = 42-2 per level until level 6, then 3 until level 11, then 4 until level 15. ''This is capped at 1 second at level 15.''}} seconds. When fully matured, '''Ivern''' can interact with the camp again to ''free'' the monsters after {{fd|0.5}} seconds, sending them away while receiving their {{tt|{{g|full gold}} and {{sti|experience|{{as|full experience}}}}|not full when freeing Krug camp, see notes}} [[bounty|bounties]]. {{si|Smite|Smiting}} a large [[monster]] within a ''grove'' will instantly ''free'' the camp's monsters, regardless of its maturity or the monsters' current health.
i1.description3: If the camp's large [[monster]] has already been slain, '''Ivern''' will ''free'' the camp upon completing the channel at no cost. Similarly, the ''grove'' will instantly mature if the large monster is slain.
i1.description4: Starting at level 5, freeing the {{ui|Red Brambleback}} or the {{ui|Blue Sentinel}} leaves behind a ''sapling'' that can be picked up by an allied champion to gain the camp's buff, consuming it in the process. If at least one allied [[champion]] is nearby, '''Ivern''' can pick up the ''sapling'' to transfer it to the nearest one in range. If an ally kills either monster, they also leave behind a ''sapling'' that only '''Ivern''' can consume.
i1.notes:
* ''Friend of the Forest'' can be used while ''Ivern'' or the camp is in combat and, once the ''grove'' is placed, {{si|Smite}} can be used to instantly claim the camp. Interrupting the channel or killing ''Ivern'' is the only way to contest jungle camps, short of killing the camp during the channel time.
*  If the large monster in a camp is still alive, Ivern must gain vision of it to use Friend of the Forest on that camp.
* If the large monster in a camp is still alive, Ivern will walk towards it to use Friend of the Forest. Attempting to use Friend of the Forest on the camp’s smaller monster will not change the total distance that Ivern walks.
* ''Friend of the Forest'' will leave ''Ivern'' at 1 current health if cast with exactly the required amount. ''Friend of the Forest'' cannot be cast with less, unlike other abilities with health costs.
* Non-epic monsters turned hostile by an allied or an enemy champion will still attack ''Ivern'' if he is the closest target (he is not immune to monster damage) yet he still cannot return fire if so (despite not being the one turning the monsters hostile)
* {{ui|Daisy}} also cannot attack non-epic [[monster]]s.
* Monsters are not hurt nor do they become hostile by ''Ivern'' when he is equipped with an item that has the [[Named_item_effect#Immolate|Immolate]] effect.
* Freeing a camp does not grant the ''Healing Rune'' that monsters usually grant on-kill.
* The ''sapling'' left behind by ''Friend of the Forest'' lasts for only 1 minute before completely disappearing.
* Whenever Ivern ''frees'' any jungle camp, he will increase his [[Farming|Creep Score]] based on the amount of monsters that were alive in the ''grove'' at the time that Ivern ''freed'' said jungle camp (for example, if he frees a {{ui|Crimson Raptor}} camp along with all the five {{ui|Raptor}}s alive, it will count as 6 creeps as usual). However, if he ''frees'' a {{ui|Krug}} camp, it will only count as 2 creeps, and he will only gain {{g|80}} rather than the usual {{g|120}}.

q1.name: Rootcaller
q1.blurb: Ivern conjures a vine, dealing damage and rooting enemy targets hit. Ivern's allies can dash to the rooted target.
q1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Ivern''' throws a vine in the target direction, dealing {{tip|magic damage|{{as|magic damage}}}} to the first enemy hit and {{tip|root|rooting}} them for a short duration.
q1.description2: '''Ivern''' and his allies can target enemies {{tip|root|rooted}} by ''Rootcaller'' to {{tip|dash}} to them, placing themselves at {{sti|range|their attack range}} from the target.
q1.notes:
* ''Rootcaller'' can hit monsters and allow '''Ivern''' to dash to them although it won't deal damage.
* '''Ivern''' can also recast this ability to dash to targets.
* '''Ivern''''s pull/attack range is determined when he dashes to the target -- not from when he initially casts ''Rootcaller'' and throws the vine.
* '''Ivern''' (and allies?) are not able to dash to the target unless they are within approximately 1200 range.

w1.name: Brushmaker
w1.blurb: In brush, Ivern's attacks are ranged and deal bonus magic damage. Ivern can activate this ability to create a patch of brush.
w1.description: {{sbc|Passive:}} While in {{tip|brush}}, '''Ivern's''' basic attacks become {{tip|ranged}} {{tip|projectiles}} with {{sti|range|325 '''bonus''' range}} and deal {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}}. These bonuses persist for 3 seconds after leaving brush.
w1.description2: '''Ivern''' periodically [[stocks]] a ''Brushmaker'' charge, up to a maximum of 3.
w1.description3: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Ivern''' grows a patch of brush at the target location for 30 seconds, {{tip|sight|revealing}} the area within and around it for 3 seconds. ''Brushmaker'' spawns more brush if used near terrain or other brush.
w1.notes:
* The bonus magic damage affects towers.
* Spawning bushes does not utilize projectiles.

e1.name: Triggerseed
e1.blurb: Ivern places a shield on an ally which explodes after a short duration slowing and damaging enemies.
e1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Ivern''' gifts a ''Triggerseed'' to the target allied champion, himself or {{ui|Daisy}}, {{tip|shielding}} them for 2 seconds.
e1.description2: At the end of its duration, ''Triggerseed'' bursts, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to all nearby enemies and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them for 2 seconds.
e1.notes: *''Triggerseed'' on allied champions grants them all kill credits it causes.

r1.name: Daisy!
r1.blurb: Ivern summons his Sentinel friend Daisy to fight with him. Daisy will send out a shockwave if she attacks the same champion three times in a row.
r1.description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Ivern''' summons his sentinel friend {{ui|Daisy}} at his side, who remains {{tt|on the field|2500 leash range}} for 60 seconds as a controllable {{tip|minion}}.
r1.description2: While {{ui|Daisy}} is active, ''Daisy!'' can be used to move her to the target location. If cast on '''Ivern''' himself, she will follow him.
